snippet: The Australian Open cafeteria offers goji berries and sushi, the child-care center has a staff of sitters, and the event provides stipends for travel and expenses.
abstract: Australian Open, in effort to improve tennis players' lives, plans to build $100 million center for player services that will include his-and-her hot-and-cold plunge pools, outdoor and indoor player lounges, high-tech locker rooms and more.

byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and JOHN MARTIN

lead_paragraph: The Australian Open cafeteria offers goji berries and sushi, the child-care center has a staff of sitters, and the event provides stipends for travel and expenses.

headline.main: Australian Open Intent on Leading the World in Pampering Players
headline.print_headline: A Tournament Intent on Leading the World in Pampering Players
